If we detect your DNS records are valid,: If we detect your DNS records are valid, then we will send you an automated email alert.  We routinely check DNS records for your domain every few hours.

In February 2020, we released the Enhanc: In February 2020, we released the Enhanced Privacy Protection plan.  This plan allows users to switch off setting public DNS record entries with their email forwarding configuration aliases. Through this plan, a user's email alias information is hidden from being publicly searchable over the Internet. We also released a feature to enable or disable specific aliases while still allowing them to appear as a valid email address and return a successful

(before we solely used Digital Ocean).  Both of these providers are SOC 2 Type 2 compliant – see

Throughout March to July 2024, we releas: Throughout March to July 2024, we released major optimizations and improvements to our IMAP, POP3, and CalDAV service.  Our goal was to make our service snappy –  and as fast, if not faster than alternatives.

Additionally, we now allow users to encrypt their plaintext DNS TXT records even on the free plan at no cost. Make sure to replace the values above in: Make sure to replace the values above in the "Value" column with your own email address.  The "TTL" value does not need to be 3600, it could be a lower or higher value if necessary.  A lower time to live ("TTL") value will ensure any future changes made to your DNS records are propagated throughout the Internet quicker – think of this as how long it will be cached in-memory (in seconds). Note that there is a difference between: Note that there is a difference between "-all" and "~all".  The "-" indicates that the SPF check should FAIL if it does not match, and "~" indicates that the SPF check should SOFTFAIL.  We recommend to use the "-all" approach to prevent domain forgery.

Please note that in order to maintain IP: Please note that in order to maintain IP reputation and ensure deliverability, we have a manual review process on a per-domain basis for outbound SMTP approval. This typically takes less than 24 hours, with most requests being honored within 1-2 hours. In the near future we aim to make this process instant with additional spam controls and alerting. This process ensures that your emails reach the inbox and your messages don't get marked as spam.
We rate limit users and domains to 300 o: We rate limit users and domains to 300 outbound SMTP messages per 1 day. This averages 9000+ emails in a calendar month. If you need to exceed this amount or have consistently large emails, then please contact us.
